channel.title: [PI] Can't attack custom added NPC Rep ++
channel.description:
Hey guys,
I put corp, and all the gwd npc in my server, some of them work (sara, bandos), but the other you can't attack at all. They will attack you if they are set to aggressive (no shit), but if you try to attack them it just won't work.
I used the extremex source, and client which is PI, and it already had the gwd npc in it, but i added corp, and the problem occurs..
please help =[

item.title: [PI] Can't attack custom added NPC Rep ++
item.dc:creator: @war_of_godzz war of godzz
item.description:
@war_of_godzz wrote:

mines added but still no work

Read full topic
item.source: [PI] Can't attack custom added NPC Rep ++

item.title: [PI] Can't attack custom added NPC Rep ++
item.dc:creator: @runewings317 runewings317
item.description:
@runewings317 wrote:

[quote=“Sythy, post:4, topic:389430”][quote author=runewings317 link=topic=485349.msg3556040#msg3556040 date=1301887033]
If you didn’t add them server sided they won’t work. Go into your server files, go to Data > cfg > npc.cfg. Open that up and put this in there:

Make sure you put a tab in between all the brackets!

The reason it won’t work without this is because what this is saying is there is no HP to actually hit if its not there. So when you add this its linking the NPC with the desired HP.
[/quote]

Wow dude, thanks so much, it works perfectly =][/quote]Any time! ^_^. If you need anymore help just PM me

Read full topic
item.source: [PI] Can't attack custom added NPC Rep ++

Make sure you put a tab in between all the brackets!

The reason it won’t work without this is because what this is saying is there is no HP to actually hit if its not there. So when you add this its linking the NPC with the desired HP.[/quote]

Wow dude, thanks so much, it works perfectly =]

@runewings317 wrote:

If you didn’t add them server sided they won’t work. Go into your server files, go to Data > cfg > npc.cfg. Open that up and put this in there:

Make sure you put a tab in between all the brackets!

The reason it won’t work without this is because what this is saying is there is no HP to actually hit if its not there. So when you add this its linking the NPC with the desired HP.
